intro: Marsdenia ferreyrae, commonly known as the Ferreyra's Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody vines and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions. Its flowers are often pink or purple and attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
